Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection 2 out of 3 employees files reviewed did not have the previous employment verified and did not have reference checks documented.

During the inspection it was found that the 3 out of the 3 employee files did not have a pre-employment drug screening on file. 1 out of 3 employees files reviewed did not have the form 2985 signed by the employee. And a review of the recent discharge file had an incorrect date on the discharge paperwork.
During the inspection it was found that 2 of the 3 employee records reviewed did not have the affidavit form 2912.
One staff record reviewed missing documentation of Trauma Informed Care training for 2024.
Correction Narrative:
Three initial trainings required yearly are Trauma Informed Care, Mandatory Reporting, and Normalcy. Training information is provided to each Youth-Reach Houston staff member via direct communication, via text, and via email.
Trauma Informed Care training information is provided to each staff member during the first week in January each year.
Training Informed Care training is to be completed in a timely manner on each care-givers personal device.
Once completed the certificate of training is to be forwarded/give directly to the Licensed Child Care Administrator.
The Child Care Administrator will keep a digital record of all staff training.
A hard copy will be placed in the care-givers file. 


Training & Communication
Weekly and monthly training sessions will be scheduled and mandatory for all staff.
Retraining will occur as needed based on inspection results or identified deficiencies.
A training log will be maintained to track staff participation and topics covered.
Scheduled future training will be set on a perpetual calendar made available to all staff.


Assigned Responsibilities
Child Care Administrator: Responsible for implementing training programs, ensuring proper handling of all medications and supplements.
On-Duty Staff: Disburse and log all medications given properly.
Volunteers and auxiliary staff cannot dispense medication/supplements. 
Child Care Administrator: Final authority on policy enforcement and communication with our licensing agency.

Deficiency Narrative: Several bottles of OTC medications were found on top of the medicine cabinet.
Correction Narrative:
Medicine cabinets and keys have been moved to a secure location behind a locked door. Caregivers are the only persons allowed in the room and is clearly marked as a Red Zone that is locked and where children are not allowed to enter without a care-giver present.

The room entry door is to remain locked when vacant.
The medicine cabinet must be locked, and the key stowed in the lock box when not in use.
Only Youth-Reach caregivers are permitted to dispense both prescription, non-prescription medications, and prescribed supplements.
Caregiver must log all medications dispensed.


Monitoring & Inspections
Weekly inspections will be conducted for medications not stowed properly.
Weekly inspections of prescription and non-prescription logs will be conducted.
Logs will be reviewed weekly by the Child Care Administrator for accuracy and completeness.
Minimum Standards will be reviewed with caregivers to ensure proper storage and disbursing of medications.

A follow-up inspection was conducted on 5/29/25. The medication cabinet was moved from the kitchen to the staff's room and was double locked during my visit.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff record reviewed finds that staff member did not receive EBI training every 6 months as required by minimum standards.
Correction Narrative:
EBI refresher training was conducted on April 1, 2025. EBI Refresher Training is scheduled and is on the Youth-Reach Houstons Operations calendar for October 11, 2025.
	
Training is required for all staff involved with operations.
Staff has been notified orally and via a calendar invitation.
Periodic reminders will be given to all staff.
Training records will be updated for each staff upon completion of training. 



Training & Communication
Weekly and monthly training sessions will be scheduled and mandatory for all staff.
Retraining will occur as needed based on inspection results or identified deficiencies.
A training log will be maintained to track staff participation and topics covered.
Scheduled future training will be set on a perpetual calendar made available to all staff.


Assigned Responsibilities
Child Care Administrator: Responsible for implementing training programs, ensuring proper handling of all medications and supplements.
On-Duty Staff: Disburse and log all medications given properly.
Volunteers and auxiliary staff cannot dispense medication/supplements. 
Child Care Administrator: Final authority on policy enforcement and communication with our licensing agency.

Deficiency Narrative:
The deficiencies noted on the sanitation inspection report dated 6/28/24 were not corrected as required by the inspector.
The agency is being recited for failure to respond by due date.
One staff's file reviewed did not have a trauma informed care training.
Documentation provided indicated the operation conducted fire drills longer than the required six months from the last drill conducted.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated both smoke detector testing and fire drills will be on the calendar and conducted periodically to coincide with the minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: No documentation provided to show that the smoke detectors are tested monthly.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated both smoke detector testing and fire drills will be on the calendar and conducted periodically to coincide with the minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff members background check was not made inactive in a timely manner.
Correction Narrative: The operation deactivated the background check in question. The operation stated they will ensure to deactivate background checks for non-employees in a timely manner in the future.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff list, child list, staff files, and child files contained inaccurate and incomplete information.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated the documents in question were corrected and in the future documentation will be more thoroughly checked for accuracy.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of two employee files reviewed did not include a job description.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated the staff's job description has sense been placed in the file and other staff files were checked to ensure they contained the job description as well.

Deficiency Narrative: There is no documentation of server weather drills being conducted.
Correction Narrative: The operation stated both smoke detector testing and fire/severe weather drills will be on the calendar and conducted periodically to coincide with the minimum standards.

Deficiency Narrative: according to medication log, medication was not recorded on log to reflect administration of pain medication due to injury.
Correction Narrative: Administrator provided updated training for all staff held on 7/11 and 7/13. Administrator also provided updated med log to include reason medication is being taken.

Deficiency Narrative: While observed records, there was no information observed of issues that could escalate the child's behavior.
Correction Narrative: All pertinent information of childs behavior noted from the initial interview through providing placement is to be documented in the Intake Study, the Preliminary Service Plan.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that the operation built a new shed and items from the shed was sitting on the basketball court for a number of days.
Correction Narrative: All the items on the basketball court were stored in the shed the same afternoon as our inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff and one child did not have proof of a TB test.
Correction Narrative: For all files, staff, volunteer, child in placement checklist is used to ensure all required documents are in each file. TB test results have been submitted.

Deficiency Narrative: While reviewing records, it was observed that one staff did not have normalcy training.
Correction Narrative: Training was completed and submitted to Licensing. Checklist for all training provided will be marked for each staff when training is complete.

Deficiency Narrative: In one bedroom, it was observed that the light fixture was wobbly. In the kitchen, it was observed that there is a loose board under the sink.
Correction Narrative: All the items on the basketball court were stored in the shed the same afternoon as our inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that the tire pressure was low on two vans that transport children and one van the heat did not properly work.
Correction Narrative: The maintenance of all vehicles used by Youth-Reach Houston have been put into our Maintain X app for weekly inspection of tire pressure, fluids, wiper blades and other miscellaneous items. The van with the heat issue is in the shop and being looked into. A work order has been submitted and will be attached to this document.

Deficiency Narrative: While observing records, it was noted that a child was informed one day before discharge instead of four days.
Correction Narrative: The child in question was a flight risk. The parent was informed of the situation prior to his discharge, but we will follow the minimum standard in the future and take the risk. The operation will ensure children are notified four days prior to being discharged.

Deficiency Narrative: It was observed that some food items were placed in Ziploc bags with no expiration date.
Correction Narrative: All foods, donations and left-overs primarily will be marked with two dates before going into refrigerator/freezer storage; each individual container will be marked with a received-by date and an expiry date. As our groceries are supplemented by the Houston Food Bank, opened and mealtime left-over items are good for three days. Refrigerators and freezers will be inventoried and cleaned every other day to ensure all foods stored are within the proper date range.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection the operation water pressure was observed to be low.  The water pressure was not hot in both homes.  It was observed that only the kitchen sink had adequate pressure.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator provided photos of the water running showing the water flow and also the temperature reading of the water from a thermometer placed under the running water.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of the grounds it was observed that there was were significant plain-sight hazards. Those hazards were loose pile of bricks (photo taken), broken outside door frame where grounds equipment is stored (photo taken)Water damage in the weight room near air-conditioning, back of weight room building there  was visible debris such as a washing machine, roof shingles, old table, and wood boards. (photos taken)
Correction Narrative: The Administrator provided photos of the outside storage building door repaired and secured with a lock; storage building cleaned and organized; sheetrock repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection it was observed that the operation had two homes with expired food. stored  This is not safe and shows poorly maintained quality food control for the children in care. There were expired milk, canned goods, bread.
Correction Narrative: The Administrator provided a photo of the expired foods emptied out of the kitchen. The foods were loaded into in bins and placed in a vehicle to be donated. The Administrator also provided a newly created document for daily/weekly inspections of foods and drinks in the kitchen, refrigerators, and pantry.
